While trying to implement recursive directory creation, somehow rustc gave the following error message:

[consider giving this closure parameter a type](https://imgur.com/2QrHzKs)

code:
```rust
//dir is &str
let dir: PathBuf = match Path::new(dir).canonicalize() { 
         Ok(v) => v,
         Err(e) => {
             Path::new(dir).iter().fold(PathBuf::new(), |mut buf, x: &OsStr| {
                 buf.push(x);
                 if !buf.exists() {
                     std::fs::create_dir(<PathBuf as AsRef<Path>>::as_ref(&buf)).unwrap();
                 }
                 buf
             }).canonicalize().unwrap()
         }
     };
```
As can be seen, `buf` 
I didn't expect any type errors, but I might be wrong.
